item.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Strcpy
item.description: Tony Hawk's Pro Strcpy: A game save and RCE exploit for the Tony Hawk game series that can be used to hack Xbox, Playstation 2, Gamecube, and Xbox 360 consoles.
item.author: (Ryan Miceli)

item.title: Adding .NET Aspire to your existing .NET apps - .NET Blog
item.description: .NET Aspire can really simplify local development for your existing apps, large or small. In this post, we'll look at how easy it is to make your current solutions better with just a few lines of code.

item.title: EP–1320 medieval
item.description: hurdy gurdys, lutes, gregorian chants, thundering drums andpercussive foley fx, all at the press of a button. the EP–1320 is the first of its kind:featuring a large library of phrases, play ready instruments and one-shot samplesfrom the darkest of ages, the instrumentalis electronicum is the ultimate,and only, medieval beat machine.

item.title: Tracking supermarket prices with playwright
item.description: Back in Dec 2022, when inflation was running high, I built a website for tracking price changes in the three largest supermarkets of my home country, Greece.

item.title: Y'all are sleeping on HTTP/3
item.description: Wake up call This post is about HTTP/3 and QUIC. If you don’t know what that is, there are many, many, many, many, many, many, many good resources that will get you up to speed. I’m writing this post to enlighten people on what has been happening in the last few years. All major browsers support HTTP/3 now. Most major cloud providers support HTTP/3 now. Most major load balancers support HTTP/3 now.
item.author: (Kevin McDonald Kevin)
